text: you kind of want to not be stuck in what
I call the text head so looking down at
your phone constant always having your
head and your neck and a flexed position
is not great for you spine in the way I
have the corollary because I'm in the
operating room
I'm always looking down you know on the
operating field and as you do that as
the day goes on you start to notice a
lot of pain especially in the back of
your neck actually up towards the the
base of your skull and so you kind of
want to not be stuck you know and in
what I call the text head you know
position you want to kind of move around
and keep your head moving around as much
as you can kind of unload the joints in
the back of your neck I think that you
know if you are constantly in a bad
posture you just kind of learn to be in
a bad posture I'm a Catholic school kid
we have to be good posture all the time
you know and I think that it's
advantageous you're not gonna end up
slouched over dragging your knuckles but
it's not good to be bent over although I
don't know if that's realistic that's
what I would suggest just try and keep
your posture just be cognizant
